Copying 5.3/6.0 Projects

Copy 5.3/6.0 projects into project databases to upgrade them to the new project format. Use the Copy Project wizard to override default options for upgraded projects.

To copy a 5.3/6.0 project into a project database:

  1. Open the project database into which you want to copy the project.

  2. Expand the appropriate 5.3/6.0 project root and select the project you want to upgrade.

  3. Select Edit | Copy. The Copy Project Select Destination Project Database or Project dialog box appears.

  4. Select the project database or project into which you will copy the 5.3/6.0 project.

  5. Click Next. The Copy Project/Organize New Project Structure dialog box appears.

  6. Specify how you will organize the new project. You can organize the project based the 5.3/6.0 project structure, or organize it based on workfile hierarchy.

  7. Click Next. The Copy Project/Select Archive Location dialog box appears.

  8. Select an archive location for the new project. You can continue to reference the archives in their current location, or copy them to the new project archive directory.

  9. Click Next. The Copy Project/Select Configuration File and Access Control Database dialog box appears.

  10. Specify configuration file and access control database options. You can continue to refer to existing configuration files and access control databases in their current location, copy them to the new project location, or create new configuration files and access control databases.

  11. Click Finish.
